text: CLOSE ON - A CAPTAIN'S LOG, as itвЂ™s yanked from a shelf REVEAL the Cook, as he opens the log, flips rapidly throu the pages. Looking for something. Running out of time. Finally, he finds the page he was looking for. Rips it ou rolls it up, inserts it into a SMALL LEATHER POUCH...

The Cook emerges, trying to blend in. Heads down a corrid but quickly has to take cover as heвЂ™s almost steamrolle A THRONG OF MEN emerging from the armory, carrying CUTLAS RIFLES-- The Cook hides-- Waits for them to pass... The coast clear, he emerges. And takes note of the armory and its HEAVY IRON DOOR...

The Cook enters. ItвЂ™s empty. He exhales. But as he turn to shut the door-- ItвЂ™s stuck. He gives it a shove, but DOOR SHOVES BACK-- THE DOOR THEN BURSTS INWARD, knocking Cook on his ass. (He doesnвЂ™t notice that the MYSTERIOUS POUCH slips out of his coat, and slides under a table...) A YOUNG SAILOR enters. 20s. Handsome. He spots the Cook down on his ass. The Sailor winces regretfully...
Sorry. The Young Sailor shuts the door. Locks the deadbolt.
What are you doing? Why arenвЂ™t you up there with the crew?
I think the better question is, why arenвЂ™t they all down here with us? You could get killed up there... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
So youвЂ™re a coward then?
Yes. You too?
IвЂ™m no coward! IвЂ™m a cook, I have no station to man. What do you think this crew will do when they find out you abandoned yours?
Well if theyвЂ™re dead, and IвЂ™m still alive... IвЂ™11 like my chances. Suddenly, the noises from above stop. Eerie silence. The Cook then turns back to the Sailor, and grins a nasty gri
If you fight, at least your death will be a quick one... (off the SailorвЂ™s look) When the pirates take this ship, and find you down here... They will show you immeasurable cruelty.
Torture...? The Cook senses the sailorвЂ™s fear, runs with it.
Do you not know who that is out there?
Our first good look at the Pirate Ship, closing in... Menacing... We get a clear look at itвЂ™s BLACK PENNANT--
That ship flies the banner of Captain Flint... And we then PULL BACK TO REVEAL weвЂ™re on the deck of--

Where itвЂ™s deserted. Not a soul above deck. Except for FIRST MATE, standing by the door of the QUARTERDECK CABIN makeshift bunker at the stern of the ship.) Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

A monster so violent and cruel, itвЂ™s said even Blackbeard himself shudders at his mention... The Mate watches as the Pirate Ship closes in... A PIRATE SNIPER takes a potshot at the Mate-- Misses by inches. Th Mate recoils. Realizes heвЂ™s out of time... He makes the of the cross, then enters the bunker, and SLAMS THE DOOR-
Cook and Sailor, alone in the armory.
And his crew... Bloodthirsty savages, eager and willing to do his bidding...
(beat) Isn't this your problem, too?
Good cooks are in short supply. Even for criminals. TheyвЂ™ll take me in. But you... cowering below decks to dodge a fight? They'll gut you for sport. The Sailor considers that a moment. Then--
I donвЂ™t know... IвЂ™m one of those people thatвЂ™s hard to dislike... On the Cook, getting frustrated. The moment is broken by sound of MULTIPLE THUDS up above... Off Cook and Sailor--

GRAPPLING HOOKS FLY OVER THE BULWARKS of the Merchant Shi landing on the deck with a SERIES OF THUDS, before being pulled tight... Straining... Pulling us closer to the Pirate Ship... PULL BACK TO REVEAL WEвЂ™RE IN-- THE QUARTERDECK BUNKER, looking out through a small LOOPH ItвЂ™s cramped in here. Dark. Merchant Sailors (including First Mate) peer out of the loopholes, RIFLES at the read ON THE MERCHANT CAPTAIN, at the rear of the crowded bunke Nervous. Waiting. Listening to the sounds of the GRAPPLIN ROPES straining, as his ship is hauled in by the Pirates. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Around him, SAILORS hold cutlasses, axes... In case the bunker is breached.
Collision up! And as the Pirate Ship finally SLAMS INTO THE MERCHANT SH
The Cook and Sailor are thrown to the ground from the collision... As they fall, we see THE LEATHER POUCH slide of his hiding place, into the open. Meanwhile--

The Sailors right themselves, resume their positions by t loopholes-- Peer out to see-- PIRATES-- Swarming onto the deck-- Among them, their PIRA CAPTAIN, identifiable even at this distance by the way he confidently directs and positions his men...
Jesus Christ... ThatвЂ™s him isnвЂ™t it?

Fire! The Gunmen FIRE their muskets through the loopholes. But Pirates respond... Throwing SMOKE GRENADES onto the Merch Ship deck... Quickly, THE DECK IS COVERED IN A HAZE OF SMOKE. The Pirates disappear into it. And all goes silent The Merchant Captain stares out into the smoke. Beat.

Powder boxes. On my command. By his feet, a RUNNER nods, before ducking down a ladder THE SUB DECK, where the Runner silently SIGNALS another SAILOR, stationed down a narrow corridor... Then ANOTHER. Until the silent message finally reaches-- A GALLEY FULL OF TRIGGER MEN... A DOZEN OR SO, spaced out the dark. Lit only by the faint flame from their HOT IRON Each stands by a FUSE dangling from the ceiling... Leadin to BOOBY TRAPS on the deck above... BACK IN THE BUNKER, with the Captain, as he peers out int the silent smoky haze. Listening. Waiting for some signal as to the pirates position... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
Come closer, bastards... The silence persists. The tension builds. And we GO:
Where the Cook and the Sailor are dusting themselves off, ship quiet for the moment. The Cook notices, however, tha the Sailor is HOLDING THE MYSTERIOUS POUCH he dropped...
Give me that...
What is it?
ItвЂ™s nothing. Give it to me! The Cook SNATCHES THE POUCH from the SailorвЂ™s hand, stu it back into his coat. The Sailor, being no dummy--
DoesnвЂ™t seem like nothing. Maybe when Mr. Flint gets here, he can decide if itвЂ™s nothing.
(beat; icily...) You wouldnвЂ™t want to do that...
No? Why not? The Cook pulls a CUTLASS off a rack, with a loud SCCRRRRI
Oh. And as the Cook takes a HACK AT THE SAILOR, we CUT BACK T

BACK with the Trigger Men, irons at the ready. Above, the can hear the faint sound of FOOTFALLS. CREAKS in the wood The pirates are right above us... From up the corridor, the SILENT SIGNAL arrives-- The

BACK IN THE BUNKER, the Captain waiting for the sound of exploding pirates... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 But there is no bang. No nothing. Just silence. The Captain turns to the Runner by his feet--
I told you to fire the mines!
We did, sir. On the Captain... Starting to get that sinking feeling...
How did he do that...?
Sir. We may still have time--
(ignoring him) Those mines were hidden. Proofed against tampering. A dozen of them.

Sir, if we do not surrender now, Flint will kill us all--! The Captain quickly produces a PISTOL-- POINTS IT IN THE MATEвЂ™S FACE. A tense beat. Things getting out of hand, rapidly... But the moment is broken by-- A FAINT KABOOM of a cannon firing in the distance... Foll quickly by a loud CRACK of impact. Then SILENCE. Looks exchanged-- What the hell was that? The Men all crowd up the LOOPHOLES... Peer out... And then they hear-- A DEEP, HORRIBLE GROAN... Like from some kind of monster. Goosebumps all around the bunker. The Captain then sees something out in the smoke... He in closer to his portal to get a better look... Just in time see something coming this way... SOMETHING HUGE... THE GROAN CRESCENDOES. The CaptainвЂ™s eyes go wide... He SPRINGS FOR COVER just as-- THE SHIPвЂ™S MAINMAST CRASHES INTO THE BUNKER-- Shatterin reinforced walls and roof-- IN THE MERCHANT CAPTAINвЂ™S POV... Blinded by the light p though the gaping hole in his bunker... his EARS RINGING THE SHOCK OF THE COLLAPSE... He watches as-- PIRATES storm through the opening, emerging out of the smoke... And as SWORDS BEGIN TO CLANG TOGETHER IN ANGER-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
With the Sailor, winded, as he dodges another CUTLASS SWI
Look, I get it. Whatever you've got there, itвЂ™s obviously very valuable.
You canвЂ™t even imagine-- The Cook swings again, forcing the Sailor to duck.

Hey-- LetвЂ™s be reasonable. WhatвЂ™s say I donвЂ™t breathe a word of this to anyone... Deal? The Cook summons all his strength, finally tackles the Sa to the ground. The Sailor and the Cook grapple, the Cookв bulk giving him the advantage... Pinning the Sailor down.
ItвЂ™s too late for that now... THE COOK RAISES THE CUTLASS-- Off the SailorвЂ™s panicked

Pirates and Sailors, in close quarters combat... The Merchant Captain watches, stunned... His men fighting Pirates with swords, axes, fists... Chaos... The Captain fixes on one particular Pirate. A GIANT of a man. Making quick work of defender after defender... Comi this way... The Merchant Captain is paralyzed with fear.. The Giant nears... Raises his cutlass... And just as heвЂ about to bring it down on the CaptainвЂ™s head-- CLANG! Someone deflects the GiantвЂ™s sword into a bulkhe
THE PIRATE CAPTAIN. FLINT. He and the Giant exchange a contentious glare with each other.
I believe weвЂ™ve made our point. (to the Merchant Captain) HavenвЂ™t we? Off the Merchant Captain, more than ready to surrender... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

Below deck, the fight now over. A few pirates search the belly of the ship for cargo. At their lead is an older pirate, whom weвЂ™ll later meet as GATES (60s). They reac locked door... The ARMORY. A pirate with the AXE HACKS IT OPEN, to REVEAL-- THE SAILOR, staring innocently back at him. And at the Sailor's feet, is THE COOK. Face down. Dead. With the CUTLASS STICKING UP THROUGH HIS BACK.
What happened to him?
He couldnвЂ™t handle the thought of what you might do to him. (then) I, on the other hand, would very much like to join your crew.
My name is John Silver. And I happen to be a very good cook... And off JOHN SILVER, we DISSOLVE TO:

The Merchant Captain has been tied to the mainmast. Nearb his crew (save Silver) are herded together. The GIANT we slashing his way through the bunker approaches the crew. They do their best not to cower... But then, Giant speaks
You have nothing to fear from him now. We are your brothers. On the Merchant Crew. They werenвЂ™t expecting that... Th Giant (whose name is SINGLETON), continues--

Men who work for our own survival, instead of thriving off the work of others. As are you... At this, Singleton sees Gates and Silver emerging from be This next bit is as much for GatesвЂ™s ears as anyone's.. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9

ItвЂ™s the tyrant captain that is the enemy of us all. And when you cease to fear the tyrant, he canвЂ™t last for long... Gates hears that. Sees a CROWD OF PIRATES around Singleto staring back at him with hollow, angry stares. He then po Silver towards BILLY BONES (20s), the shipвЂ™s First Mate
This one wants to join. Says he can cook. Billy nods, as Gates enters into--
--where we find Flint, and DUFRESNE (20s, bookish). Dufre sits, papers and ledgers spread all around. Flint is read one of the books. He doesnвЂ™t look up as Gates enters--
We made a full sweep of the lower holds. Twelve casks of palm oil. Eight of sugar. Some scattered tobacco, maybe a few dozen pounds.
(beat) ThatвЂ™s all? GatesвЂ™s silence affirms. Dufresne casts a concerned gla in FlintвЂ™s direction, who isnвЂ™t paying attention... D then consults his notes, does a few quick calculations...
Total tally... 400. Maybe five if we are lucky selling the tobacco. CameronвЂ™s arm is broken, and Duffy was shot in the leg. After injury payments, weвЂ™ll net just under 8 pounds per man.
8 pounds...? Flint glances up from his book. Unconcerned.
The men are not going to be happy... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
When are they ever?
When their end is a hell of a lot richer than 8 pounds... Flint smiles a bit. TouchГ©.
Here, look... Flint hands Gates the journal heвЂ™s been reading. As Gat reads, Flint talks privately to him--

CaptainвЂ™s log. The whole story is here. Vazquez. Port Royal. (a small smile) I told you this was the ship... Gates reacts, but then flips the page in the journal back forth, as if looking for something--
WhereвЂ™s the map?
Someone mustвЂ™ve torn it out. Minor obstacle, but weвЂ™re getting closer.

Minor obstacle... (then) Let me see if I have this straight. This is our fourth prize in a row from which our profits will just barely exceed the expense it took to win it. Singleton is out there right now getting your crew ready to torture that poor bastard of a captain, only because he hasn't figured out how to get them to do it to you yet. But itвЂ™s ok, because youвЂ™ve discovered that the secret map we canвЂ™t tell anyone we're looking for may exist on a page that we donвЂ™t have.
(beat) ...donвЂ™t have yet. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Gates has to smile. But then, DR. HOWELL (40s, ruddy) enters. HeвЂ™s wearing a LEATHER APRON, covered in blood.
Mr. Duffy is dead. That lands. GatesвЂ™s smile fades.
I removed the leg. But heвЂ™d lost too much blood. Dufresne does some quick scribbling. Then, solemnly--
Make that 9 pounds per man. A quiet beat, as the room darkens. Flint then starts to h for the door--
I just need a minute with the Captain... But Gates grabs his arm. Stops him--
ItвЂ™s bad out there.
Their men are all restrained.
It isnвЂ™t their men IвЂ™m worried about. Flint knows Gates is serious. Still--
We're so close. CanвЂ™t stop now... off Gates--
Gates approaches his crew. Singleton steps forward--
We paid a heavy toll today. And for what...? We all know the prize wonвЂ™t come close to making it worthwhile. Someone must be made to pay the difference... (MORE )
Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
(re: Merchant Captain) Right now, heвЂ™1l have to do... This, as Singleton sees Flint approaching the mainmast. SINGLETON (CONTвЂ™D) What is he doing?
Just... Give him a minute. ON FLINT, with the terrified Merchant Captain.
Where is the map?
What are you talking about?

The page with Vazquez's map. ItвЂ™s missing-- Do you have it? The Captain looks Flint in the eye. Silent. Flint then peeks over at Singleton and the crew. Eying the Merchant Captain like a piece of meat...
If you know something, now would be the time to say so... ACROSS THE DECK, with Gates and Singleton. Privately--
Two captains, out of touch with their men... (then) Just so you know, I have no ill- will towards you. Once I have the votes to depose Flint, there will be a place for you on my ship...
Singleton? (off his look) Shut the fuck up.

text: I told you, I donвЂ™t have it. One of my men mustвЂ™ve taken it-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
They were searched.
Your men, then.
They didnвЂ™t have access. Can you remember what you wrote down?
I wrote it down so I wouldnвЂ™t have to remember. Dammit, if I knew more I would tell you. Now call off your men! Beat. Flint looks over at the angry pirate crew... on the Merchant Captain--
You canвЂ™t, can you...? (sneers) You're their captain, and you have no control over them...
You're their captain, and they just signed your death warrant. So IвЂ™m not sure either of us is ina position to criticize. 14. It dawns The Merchant Captain darkens, no longer hiding his contem
How long before youвЂ™re the one they tie to the mast? On Flint. Done with this guy. As he walks away--
I wonвЂ™t give any of you the satisfaction of crying out!
(under his breath) Good for you. But as Flint nears the cabin--

Where are you going? (Flint stops) Justice is about to be done... And you're turning your back? Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 Flint glares. A tense moment between them. But then--
Sail ho! Everyone rushes to the starboard railing. Very small on t horizon is a SHIP. Someone hands Flint the spyglass...
ThatвЂ™s a ship of the line.
Royal Navy. The Scarborough.
Scarborough doesnвЂ™t patrol this far south.
She does today. And sheвЂ™s got the wind on us. (then, to the CREW) Sails up. WeвЂ™re leaving now. The crew races to action, no questions asked.
Minor obstacle, is it? Off Flint--
Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
FlintвЂ™s ship (the WALRUS) cruises on open waters...

A SURLY COOK in a foul apron cuts potatoes on an even fou chopping block, until he sees Silver and Billy approachin The cook stops cutting. Grumbles. Takes off his apron, an shoves it into SilverвЂ™s hands. He then sulks off, and e

He'll be alright. (then) First and third watch mess together, along with the Quarter- master. Captain usually with the second. And no extra rations, not for the Captain, not for anyone. Every man is an equal here. Clear? Silver nods. Billy turns to leave. Stops...
You can cook, right?
(beat) Of course.

(beat; then, muttered--) CanвЂ™t be any worse... And Billy exits. Silver waits til heвЂ™s gone. Then PULLS THE POUCH he took from the Cook. And pulls from it-- THE MYSTERIOUS PAGE, and we finally get a look at it. Som numbers, vaguely organized into columns. Indecipherable. flips it over, hoping for more info. Nothing. Silver slumps... What the hell is this? And as we PUSH IN on the torn edge, and we DISSOLVE TO: INT. WALRUS - CAPTAINвЂ™S CABIN - DAY ...THE FRAYED EDGES OF THE CAPTAIN'S LOG, from which the was torn. And FLINT, staring into it. Almost as if he mig will it to reappear. Gates enters, and sits. Conspicuousl silent for a beat. Flint looks up slowly...
He has the votes. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
Beg pardon?

Singleton. He has the votes to remove you as Captain. (off FlintвЂ™s look) Maybe not every last one, IвЂ™m still canvassing. But once he gets ashore, where he doesnвЂ™t have to be sneaky about it, heвЂ™ll get what he needs...
I thought you said itвЂ™d never get to this.
I did.
I thought you said you put loyal men in all the right places, so that this crew would never turn--
That was before today.
So because of one short haul--
One more short haul, to be fair. But thatвЂ™s not what did it.
Then what are you talking about?

The Scarborough. (then) They all knew the day would come when the Empire would start paying attention to us again. What if today is that day? If weвЂ™re run out of Nassau, how long before we find a new port? How lean will things get in the meantime? Scary questions. Singleton is capitalizing. Flint considers this a long beat. Then-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
So fix it.
Fix it...?
Buy them back. Twist arms. Do... Whatever it is you do.
That doesnвЂ™t quite feel like a solution to this particular problem.
I donвЂ™t need a solution, I just need a few more days...
We've been after this map for months, what makes you think all you need is a few more days?
IвЂ™m going to see Richard.
Richard Guthrie... You think heвЂ™s going to help you?
I do.
LetвЂ™s, for fun, say he doesnвЂ™t. What then?
Then I will forget about the map. We'll return to hunting fat, lazy merchantmen. And everyone will be content.
And I have your word on that? Beat. Straight face. Beat.
Of course. On Gates... Jeez... The moment is broken as Billy sticks his head in the door. A big grin on his face. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
Landfall... WeвЂ™re home. off Flint and Gates, we--
The Walrus sails into the warm blue bay, a handful of oth PIRATE SHIPS sitting at anchor nearby. TENDER SHIPS and BARGES shuttle about, ferrying passengers and cargo...

A HARBOR BARGE comes ashore, and a number of pirates disembark and begin unloading cargo. Among the crowd, Sil steps forward, and takes in-- NASSAU. Its shore crowded with crudely built HUTS, TENTS LEAN-TOS. DOZENS of pirates emerge from the encampment to greet the WalrusвЂ™s crew... Overlooking this shanty-town, up on the bluff, is an IMPO STONE FORTRESS. And beyond that, we can just make out the outlines of the townвЂ™s main thoroughfare. Altogether, a filthy, noisy but picturesque tableau.
Is this English soil?

Was. Once. Now itвЂ™s ours. This, as a TRIO of giggling WHORES burst onto the beach, passing out RUM, bread and fruit. One of them leaps into Logan's arms, buries his face in her breasts... when he finally comes up for air...

Nice, inвЂ™it? This, as A BOTTLE OF RUM is thrust into SilverвЂ™s hands. MUSIC starts up, and the scene turns festive. Off Silver, canвЂ™t quite believe his luck. As he takes a drink-- MEANWHILE... We find GATES, walking with Billy up the bea towards a small SKIFF anchored just off the sand.
I donвЂ™t understand... The Captain asked for me to go along with him?
No, but I have business here, so the job falls to you. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
And what is the job, exactly?

The Captain is going to ask Richard for a favor. Richard is going to say no. When that happens, the Captain will, most likely, react poorly. When that happens, I need you to restrain him. Billy stops dead in his tracks. It takes Gates a few step before he realizes. Doubles back to Billy...
No cargo moves off this island without Mr. GuthrieвЂ™s ships and connections. He is not someone we need to be making an enemy of.
(a very long beat) Restrain him, you say...
(pat on the shoulder) IвЂ™m sure you'll do fine. Gates heads towards the skiff, Billy following reluctantl
HeвЂ™1l never listen to me.
Nonsense. YouвЂ™re an indispensable part of this crew, and I assure you, the Captain appreciates that more than you know. --this as they arrive at the skiff. Gates addresses Flint
BillyвЂ™s going with you.

Who's Billy? Beat. Gates slow-turns to Billy. And off their look, we g BACK TO THE MAIN BEACH, where Silver is helping to unload cargo. Nearby, two CREWMEN grouse-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
What do you think our shares come to? I heard twenty...

Twenty? Singleton says we'll be lucky to see five. Over this, we notice-- Silver has stopped unloading. He's staring into a BASKET of goods from the ship. Fixed on something at the bottom of it we canвЂ™t yet see... He reaches in, and pulls out-- A BOOK. THEN ANOTHER. A handful of journals of varying sizes. Silver looks around. Makes sure no one is watching him... Carefully selects THREE BOOKS that are the same size as h MYSTERIOUS TORN-OUT PAGE... He opens one. On the first page: Captain's Log -- Vol.1. Silver compares the mystery page-- THE HANDWRITING MATCHE He then quickly flips through the book. But it doesnвЂ™t appear to be missing a page. Opens the next book. Flips. Nothing missing there either. Ditto, the third one. But h notes that the books are labelled Vols. 1, 2 and 4. THERE ONE MISSING. Off Silver, getting closer to an answer-- MOMENTS LATER, we find Dufresne, hunched over a makeshift table, recording cargo as its unloaded in a ledger...
A cook book? REVERSE, and REVEAL SILVER, standing there talking to him
ItвЂ™s absurd, I know. I left it with our Captain for safe-keeping but I donвЂ™t see it with the rest of his journals--

Everything from the captainвЂ™s quarters is here. If what youвЂ™re looking for isnвЂ™t, Flint must have kept it. (then) The Captain likes his books. Dufresne goes back to work. And Silver turns. Looks out t the Walrus, anchored out in the bay. Somehow, heвЂ™s gonn have to get back out there... But breaking the moment-- Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9
Which oneвЂ™s the new one? Silver looks over as a GAUNT, DEAD-EYED MAN is approachin him. Not from our crew. Logan steps in front of Silver--
Is this really necessary? HeвЂ™s just a cook...
He meets the new ones. No exceptions. Logan turns back to Silver, frustrated.
IвЂ™m sorry, mate...
WhatвЂ™s going on? Who wants to meet me?
(ominously) Blackbeard. Off Silver, starting to worry, we SMASH TO:
A smoky whorehouse. The Gaunt Man leads Silver through th parlor, as Logan and a few other Crewmen tag along for mo support. The Gaunt Man then stops at a set of DOUBLE DOOR
Whatever you do... DonвЂ™t show fear. On Silver. Totally at a loss. The Gaunt Man opens the doo

ItвЂ™s dark. Lit by a few dim LANTERNS. Silver enters, tu to see several SILHOUETTED figures in the back. The lante turn up... Revealing-- FIVE NAKED WHORES, draped around a large ornate chair. In chair is a FIGURE, his face obscured under a hat. Blackbe But the figure then lifts its head, revealing... A BEAUTI BLACK HAIRED WHORE, naked beneath a thin velvet robe.
You're not Blackbeard... Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 The WHORE smiles, then slowly opens her robe, revealing a large patch of unruly black PUBIC HAIR.
I see. Silver turns to see his Walrus buddies laughing at him.
DonвЂ™t fall in now, you hear? They shut the door behind him. Off Silver, we HARD CUT TO

Alright, easy now... But the whores arenвЂ™t listening. Just as Silver is abou give in, his pants are torn off, and he remembers-- THE LEATHER POUCH, which falls to the floor as his pants tossed on a chair. SilverвЂ™s eyes go wide. He makes a mo to recover it, but the nearest whore (MAX, 20s, mulatto), puts a hand on his chest.

(French creole accent) Rules are rules. And you are ours. She shoves him back down to the bed, and the orgy begins. But even now, Silver canвЂ™t help but glance over at the LEATHER POUCH... Off it, DISSOLVE TO:

Packed with drunk pirates, as Gates enters, makes his way through... As he goes, we pick up SNIPPETS of conversatio The word вЂњScarboroughвЂќ on everyone's lips. Gates also Singleton, talking intently with an older BLACK PIRATE. Gates moves to the bar, addresses the BARTENDER (MR. SCOT 50s, black).
Need a moment with your boss. Scott nods to a closed DOOR behind the bar.

Not a good time. Untitled Pirate Project - 2ND DRAFT - Steinberg/Levine 9 This, as the back room door FLIES OPEN, and an ANGRY PIRA CAPTAIN storms out, followed by a YOUNG WOMAN (mid-20s, beautiful, but with an edge). TheyвЂ™re in mid-argument.

You want to run at first sight of trouble, be my guest. But donвЂ™t expect me to fucking help you. As the PIRATE storms off, the woman realizes the entire b has grown quiet. All eyes on her. YOUNG WOMAN (CONTвЂ™D) (to the bar) That goes for all of you. If you want stay and hunt, my doorвЂ™s open. If the mere whiff of the navy is too much for you, then God bless, and get the fuck out. Muttering and such, as everyone goes back to their drinki
...-Madame Guthrie?
What the fuck do you want? She turns, and sees its Gates asking for her. Off ELEANOR GUTHRIE, proprietor of this place, WE GO:
With Gates, as he follows the Guthrie back into the offic Scott joins them, shuts the door--
